cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles east of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest tonight into the Florida Straits, then turning north-northwest to move along Florida’s west coast and eventually accelerate north-northeast across the Southeast U.S. toward New England late in the 5-day period.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast (likely Big Bend region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and tropical-storm watches extend only from the Florida Big Bend westward to Indian Pass; no Caribbean watches remain in effect.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm and storm-surge warnings cover western Cuba, the Florida Keys, and Florida’s west coast from Flamingo to the Aucilla River.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Cuba, Florida Keys, Florida’s entire west coast, and eventually the coastal sections of GA, SC, NC, and New England.
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no USVI site listed in probability table)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at St. Croix; Elsa is hundreds of miles to the west and moving away.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – St. Croix lies well outside the surge envelope associated with Elsa.
weather_observation.rainfall: None – any Elsa-related rain band activity already ended; no additional heavy rain expected.
